attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: Implement psychological well-being into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: A childs' development is fundamental for their continued success and well-being in later adult life. Schools should have a statutory responsibility to integrate psychological well-being education and support through integrating emotional coping and resilience strategies into the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people will experience a Mental Health issue in their lifetime. With Mental health being one of the main causes of the overall disease burden worldwide, and depression being the second largest cause of disability.

Educational establishments provide opportunity for students to develop academic, vocational, interpersonal and employability skills, yet fundamental psychological skills (i.e. coping, stress management) are very rarely discussed, let alone taught, understood or integrated.

attributes.action: Funding for Birmingham homeless shelters and free education/job seekers help
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We're asking for the government to invest in the UK's second largest city & provide support who most need it. We want free education and job seeker support to help get people off the streets. We also need equipment and resources.

attributes.action: Allow hospital A&E to refer people to minor injuries units if not an emergancy
attributes.background: Recently several minor injuries units in my local area were closed to staff A&E for patients that likely did not have life threatening injuries. Allow A&E departments to refuse treatment for non-emergency patients so they can focus more on saving the lives of those that need them.

attributes.action: Stricter regulations for complaints handling, for communications providers
attributes.background: Phone companies and other providers are neglecting their duties to provide effective customer service for complaints handling. Too many times we as consumers are lied to and made false promises, because these companies can.
attributes.additional_details: It's time the government responded and did something to protect consumers from unfair practice and make complaints handling legislation stricter.

attributes.action: Make car insurance more affordable for all persons who have never made a claim.
attributes.background: I never knew some years ago that my no claims bonus would expire after two years, as a result of this obtaining affordable car insurance is now near impossible! I have purchased a used car for £500 and my insurance quotes are well over £1000 with a deposit equivalent to my households weekly income!
attributes.additional_details: I think that all persons should have a "claims background record" that would be similar to credit history wear all past claims and no claims are noted. I have been driving for 15 years and have never made a claim in my life! How is it fair that I or anybody else should be penalised for not having any proof of no claims. I have had to take out temporary cover costing me £75 for 7 days until I figure out what I can do! If I took the insurance on offer simply paying the deposit would mean my children and myself would starve, no bills would get paid and we would also be without gas and electric, and that is the reality of the situation and it simply needs to change.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Reduce Vat on Post from outside the UK.
attributes.background: It is quite absurd that an item costing £19.00 ($22.00 US) should then incur a £14 odd vat and handling charge. The handling charge of £8 is placed by the Royal Mail regardless of size weight or cost of item, and is added for anything with VAT to be paid.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the Vat Charges on small items are hardly worth the cost of auditing and tracking the payments, it would probably be more cost effective to have a slightly higher cut off, this will also have the effect of reducing the resentment the British public have in paying the extraordinary large charge to the Royal Mail for low cost items.

attributes.action: Government stop using JAM to describe those on the  breadline and apologise
attributes.background: This group of people struggle to make ends meet they use food banks and often go without. This terminology is a deliberate attempt to disguise this as a sweet little group, rather than those forced to use food banks or go hungry. It is wordplay at it's most disgusting stop and apologise.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy on the use of fireworks in the UK.
attributes.background: Following a recent petition calling for a ban and the official response, to further obtain public opinion on the misuse of fireworks. Government to fund research into the impact on human and animal health and well being to be the primary aim of the research.

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid easier for donors and recipients with a single, simple mechanism
attributes.background: The mechanism to provide Gift Aid to a charity is too complex, takes too much effort and fails too often.  It is almost like the Government does not want to provide Gift Aid. Everyone would benefit is this were simpler, and more successful with a single, easy, standard mechanism.
attributes.additional_details:
Often people are put off donating because of Gift Aid complexities, Gift Aid fails or people get overburdened by different Gift Aid cards etc. Charities waste money dealing with complex Gift Aid processes.

Ideally, there would be a single, simple mechanism to provide Gift Aid. This could be a single card type mechanism provided by Charities (recognised by Government and Charities). Alternatively, a unique identifier (eg a ‘Gift Aid’ number or possibly the NI number) would be sufficient.

attributes.action: Simplify the legal process of buying and selling a home
attributes.background: Buying and selling a home in the U.K. is an overly complicated, slow, and frustrating process. Introduce a single body to deal with 'searches' (Land Registry?), create an online system to track progress and facilitate communication, and reduce the ability of parties to make changes prior to exchange
attributes.additional_details: The current system has barely changed in decades. Solicitors still communicate via post, creating huge delays waiting for various documents to be passed between parties. Too many separate entities need to be consulted, often to confirm obvious or know facts. The existing system provides no incentive to reform the process as it generates significant 'easy money' for solicitors, estate agents and others, with buyers and sellers lacking the knowledge to challenge the process.

attributes.action: HM Forces exempt Higher rate Stamp Duty on additional residential properties
attributes.background: The MOD have changed service personnels pensions, pay and allowances persistently for the worst over the last decade. To supplement their heavily reduced pensions on retirement service personnel in the past have built up property portfolios, the Government have now made this practically impossible
attributes.additional_details: In the Autumn Statement on 25 November 2015, the Chancellor of the Exchequer announced that higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax would apply from 1 April 2016 to purchases of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties. With the Armed Forces numbers shrinking on a daily basis and recruitment drives failing this would be a big incentive for serving personnel to provide a return of service for exemption from Higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT).

attributes.action: Debate why restaurants have so few allergy free options and why more isn't done
attributes.background: In many restaurants there's often only one or two gluten free options on a menu when could be more. For instance if chips were fried GF, as they would otherwise be GF. Instead often the same oil used for frying breadcrumb/batter based food to save money. There are other instances of this as well.
attributes.additional_details: It's reported 7% of U.K. population have a gluten allergy or intolerance, this affecting a few million people. There are a few restaurants that do make the effort and why not many more. For instance some restaurants use separate oil but many don't. This would very easily widen the choice when eating out with family and friends making it a much more enjoyable experience, which otherwise can be quite off-putting. This should also be debated on other allergies and what could be done to help.

attributes.action: Carbon emissions tax
attributes.background: For all UK tax payers to pay a tax of £7.50 each month of the year. Which then all money goes towards renewable energy and eventually lowers payroll tax.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone pollutes therefore everyone has a responsibility to on saving are great nation and doing our bit for the world. With the £7.50 month tax this means there will be an extra £195 Million pounds to renewable energy and research and development and in a year an extra £2.3 Billion pounds towards it!

attributes.action: Minimum 3 month driving ban and £1k fine if caught using a mobile phone driving.
attributes.background: Using a hand held mobile phone while driving can have the same consequences as drink driving. Drivers caught not using hands free devices should be subject to a minimum 3 month driving ban and a minimum £1000 fine. The only way we can try and stop this is by imposing tougher laws.

attributes.action: Pass a law so that EU roaming charges are abolished despite the Brexit vote
attributes.background: The EU has introduce a law to ban roaming charges across the union. However, as UK is leaving those laws won't apply for UK networks and charges will go up. One way is to make a law to stop networks charging for EU roaming. This law could be reciprocal to make negotiations easier.
attributes.additional_details: This law will work by making mobile networks abolish roaming charges or face fines if they fail to do so. This will protect holidaymakers from shock bills. You could also introduce a reciprocal law for EU holidaymakers coming to the UK. This means that EU mobile networks can't charge for roaming in he UK. This will make negotiations easier as it will benefit EU citizens as well.

attributes.action: To allow our Daughter in Law from China to come to UK to meet us
attributes.background:
Our son has been married for four and half years and had to sell up here in the uk to be with his wife as she had two applications turned down once because they did not believe they were married second that she would not return to China.
We are now in our late 80s and would like to meet her soon

attributes.action: Establish protocols for all new born babies with law bound practises.
attributes.background: Our youngest daughter was born with hyperextension in her right knee. The midwife refused to touch her and had no knowledge or experience of this condition. The physio didn't have experience, the health visitors ignored us when milestones were missed. How many other children were not being supported
attributes.additional_details:
After lots of nagging and persuasion we got the referrals we needed. At almost two she was finally getting the level of care she needed. The new physio told us that children as old as four were unable to walk- this lead us to question what happened to them?
The physio gave us the idea of the protocol. There are key documents supporting children with special educational needs and disabilities but they are no good without knowledge and guidelines for less well known conditions. MAKE PROTOCOLS LAW

attributes.action: Do not build an extra runway at any London airport. Increase efficiency.
attributes.background: Rather than spending millions on building a new runway we need to better use what airports we have and increase the speed and efficiency of public transport. If we are to meet global CO2 reduction targets this is of paramount importance. Air travel needs not be idolised.
attributes.additional_details: CO2 concentrations are increasing and this is causing global temperatures to rise. Rather than focusing on increased capacity for air travel, encouraging it, we need to better use the airports we have and link them with better (and greener) public transport. This is of paramount importance if we are serious about anthropogenic climate change and considering the Paris agreement. Perhaps we could create jobs in tree-planting, conservation and green energy instead?

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Allow intended parents of surrogate children, to have legal right from birth,
attributes.background: When surrogates are used they have the legal right to keep that child even if they have no biological connection, I want intended parents to have legal right of the child from birth to give more people a chance to have a child without fear of it the surrogate keeping them.

attributes.action: A standardised requirement for motor vehicle headlamps in lumen and colour.
attributes.background: Many are finding it increasingly difficult to drive at night due to the variations in lighting strength and colour. Often it is very difficult to differentiate a dipped headlight from the full beams. These are wreaking havoc with people's vision potentially causing accidents as they are dazzled.

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Make single parents and sole carers a protected category in legislation.
attributes.background: Single parents and sole carers face barriers to employment and social participation beyond those of parents and carers in general. In addition, caring responsibilities are not a recognised 'category' in legislation that protects individuals in vulnerable groups from discrimination and hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
Protected category status would prevent exclusion from services and employment by providing a legal right to access, which could be used, to ensure employers and service providers put in place extra adaptations for lone-caring responsibilities, which are a greater barrier than simply parenthood or caring with wider support. This would also enable legal redress against hate-speech often directed at lone parents.

http://tinyurl.com/zh6kkoz
https://gingerbread.org.uk/content/658/Employment

attributes.action: Increase British military support in protecting endangered animals in Africa.
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of endangered animals in Africa are being poached every year throughout the continent. Many of the countries where this poaching is most common are very limited on resources that is needed to protect these animals. The British military would have the resources to make a impact.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: Ensure fair pricing for those with worse eyesight.
attributes.background: Glass lens thickness is based on prescription strength. People with poor eyesight are limited, and must suffer (physically) from wearing heavier lenses. Vendors in the UK sell thinner lenses for a substantial premium (over £100). This pricing should be voided so glasses costs are fair for all.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Make tobacco/cigarettes illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco has been proven to have a plethora of negatives effects on the health. If the government/'experts' have the audacity to ban cannabis for its effects even with the added benefit, tobacco/cigarettes should also be banned with the lack of benefits of smoking it.

attributes.action: Reinstate Housing Benefit direct to Landlords, as Tenants do not pay their rent
attributes.background: Reinstate Housing Benefit direct to Landlord. Since payment arrangements were changed, a great number of Landlords are not receiving their rent as it is paid direct to the tenant, this can go on for many months and run to many thousands of pounds of arrears and thousands more in fees to get it back
attributes.additional_details:
Landlords get a bad press, unreasonably. They provide homes where Councils can't or won't. Most aren't rich,  just one property, for example where a couple marry and move in together, renting out the vacant 'other' property.

An example, like myself, adding to their pension. Benefit Tenants payments are paid direct to the Tenant. The recipient has several hundred pounds 'in one go' on many occasions this money is spent, but not on rent...I have experience of Tenants treating this as 'partytime'

attributes.action: NHS to be run by each local council rather than a national organisation
attributes.background: The NHS is run as a national organisation which means that money is wasted rather than being spent on the actual needs of hospitals. This would look to change that and instead give the responsibilities of running the local NHS to local councils - looking at the hospital needs, therefore less waste.

attributes.action: Parliamentary enquiry examining fully the DWP and the use of sanctions
attributes.background:
The DWP give cruel, arbitary and ridiculous reasons for stopping benefits. This leads to greater poverty, reliance on food banks, homelessness, hopelessness and suicide. 
A parliamentary enquiry similar to the enquiry held over Sports Direct.
attributes.additional_details:
www.dwpunspun.org.uk
www.rnib.org.uk/dwp-s
60 yr old amputee war veteran had benefits stopped for selling Poppies
Successful job applicants with a starting date in two weeks time, have benefits stopped because they did not continue to search for work in that two week period
A job applicants interview is longer than anticipated  leading to benefit sanctions for one month because they are 9 minutes late for the Job Centre
Benefits have been stopped because no job search took place on Christmas day

attributes.action: Educate KS4 students with functional skills they can use later in life.
attributes.background: In schools students are taught a variety of different things, but something the education system doesn't teach is functional skills. Being 16 I have no idea how to pay tax or take out a mortgage on a house but we get taught how to analyse 18th century literature..
attributes.additional_details: I would like MORE time dedicated in our schooling (once in KS4) to things we can use later in everyday life in exchange for things that only a small percentage of us will use later in life.

attributes.action: Develop a train service from Sheerness to Leysdown
attributes.background: The isle of Sheppey has recently seen a huge development in Neatscourt retail park near Queenborough, but the infrastructure has not been developed to allow residents from perhaps Leysdown to access it. If there was a train with multiple stops across the island, people would access its shops easier.

attributes.action: To stop the government removing the subsidy for blood test strips.
attributes.background: I would like to ask the government not to remove the subsidy for blood test strips. Diabetics need very frequent blood testing 5+ times a day. The cost of strips is £70.00 the outcome of stopping this is reduced blood glucose testing and more hospital admissions from hyper or hypo glycemic Diabetes.

attributes.action: A referendum to stop HS2 & spend the money on more appropriate things.
attributes.background: The previous Labour Gov't and subsequent administrations are grandstanding to create a new railway, which will make the journey between London and Birmingham 20 minutes shorter. This will destroy so many pretty villages and people's homes & at present is estimated to cost between £50 & £80 billion.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the 19th century where our Victorian forbears really were innovative and had great reasons to build. They were investing in the great Industrial revolution for it to work then and there. The HS2 project will come to "fruition" in 30 years time and by that time, it is very possible it will be out of date. Businessmen can work on trains and often this journey is beneficial to a meeting. Cutting the journey time by 20 minutes is a false economy, whilst so many other projects need funds.

attributes.action: All new members of the House of Lords should sit for 10 years
attributes.background:
The present House of Lords has been a mockery for many many years.viz Iolanthe written in the 1800s. Major reform is unlikely. However my minor change would, in due time, reduce the numbers.
It should not be difficult to make this change.

attributes.action: Change the law on pricing of haircuts/colour. Shouldn't matter what sex you are.
attributes.background: Females have been fighting for equal opportunity for decades. I called a hairdresser today to book an appointment for my partner. I asked for a price and got asked if my partner was male or female, I asked why that was important and I was told because for a female it is more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Females have been fighting for equal opportunities for centuries. Charging females more for a haircut is no different to females getting paid less for doing the same job as a male. There should be gender neutral pricing laws. The pricing for haircuts/colour should be based on the length of the hair, not the sex of the person having their hair done. I called Kula Kuts in Kent and Toni & guy and both these salons informed me that a female having the same haircut or colour as a male would pay more.

attributes.action: Stop the Port of Dover using the A20 coast bound lane as a lorry park
attributes.background: For over ten years the port of dover has been stacking lorries on the A20 heading to the port. causing problems to local residents the works are now finished in the port and the main road to it now is the time to stop the practice of stacking lorries in front of our homes.
attributes.additional_details: A new road improvement costing millions has just been completed  with two lanes now in use. Port of Dover Police are stopping lorries on the outskirts of dover for the reason of not blocking the port which also has had a major road improvement with ten lanes to hold the lorries
